meanings.definition: A region and former province on the western coast of the Netherlands.
meanings.sent1: Holland is known for its beautiful tulip fields.
meanings.sent2: I dream of visiting Holland one day to see the windmills.
meanings.sent3: Why did the cheese go to Holland? For the Gouda!
meanings.sent4: Her paintings were as colorful as a field of tulips in Holland.
meanings.sent5: The wooden shoes from Holland are so unique and charming.

meanings.definition: A coarse linen fabric used for window shades and clothing.
meanings.sent1: She sewed a lovely dress using Holland fabric.
meanings.sent2: The curtains were made of Holland to keep the sun out.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tailor bring a map of Holland to work? To find the fabric!
meanings.sent4: The Holland material felt rough like sandpaper against her skin.
meanings.sent5: The Holland cloth had a distinct texture that set it apart from others.

meanings.sent1: The soup was filled with delicious Holland beans.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy snacking on Holland beans with a sprinkle of salt.
meanings.sent3: Why did the pod of beans refuse to go to Holland? It was too broad!
meanings.sent4: The Holland beans in the salad added a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the cooking Holland beans filled the kitchen.
